intro: Bridelia montana, commonly known as mountain bridelia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Bridelia montana is often found in rocky or sandy soils in woodland and shrubland habitats. It has some ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and seasonal flowering.
